gurmukhi: ਛੁਦ੍ਰ ਮੀਨ ਛੁਰੁੱਦ੍ਰਕਾ ਅਰੁ ਚਰਮ ਕਛਪ ਅਨੰਤ ||
transliteration: Chhudra Moond Chhuruddrakaa Ar(u) Charam Kachhapanant||
translation: Thhe swords on the bodies of the demons appear like small fish and the shields look like tortoises.

gurmukhi: ਨੱਕ੍ਰ ਬੱਕ੍ਰ ਸੁ ਬਰਮ ਸੇਭਿਤ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਨੀਰ ਦੁਰੰਤ ||੩੪||
transliteration: Nakkra Bakkra Su Baram Sobhit Sron Noor Durant||34||
translation: On their bodies, the steel-armour looks elegant and the blood is flowing down like flood.34.

gurmukhi: ਨਵ ਸੂਰ ਨਵਕਾ ਸੇ ਰਥੀ ਅਤਰਥੀ ਜਾਨ ਜਹਾਜ ||
transliteration: Nav Soor Navkaa Se Rathoo Atrathoo Jaan Jahaaj||
translation: The new young warriors appear like boats and thhe charioteers look like shimps.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਦਿ ਲਾਦਿ ਮਨੋ ਚਲੇ ਧਨ ਧੀਰ ਬੀਰ ਸਲਾਜ ||
transliteration: Laadh Laadh Mano Chale Dhan Dhoor Boor Salaaj||
translation: All this appears as if the traders loading their commodities are coyly running out of the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਮੋਲੁ ਬੀਚ ਫਿਰੈ ਚੁਕਾਤ ਦਲਾਲ ਖੇਤ ਖਤੰਗ ||
transliteration: Mol(u) Boodhe Phirai Choukaat Dalaal Khet Khatan||
translation: The arrows of the battlefield are like the agents, who are busy in settling the account of the transaction.

gurmukhi: ਗਾਹਿ ਗਾਹਿ ਫਿਰੈ ਫਵੱਜਨਿ ਝਾਰਿ ਦਿਰਬ ਨਿਖੰਗ ||੩੫||
transliteration: Gadh(i) Gadh(i) Phirai Phavajjan(i) Jdaar(i) Dirab Nikhan||35||
translation: The armies are fastly moving in the field for settlement and emptying their treasure of quivers.35.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗ ਗਿਰੇ ਕਹੂੰ ਬਹੁ ਰੰਗ ਰੰਗਿਤ ਬਸਤ੍ਰ ||
transliteration: An Bhan Gire Kahoon Bahu Ran Ranit Bastra||
translation: Some where multi-coloured garments and chopped limbs are lying.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਮ ਬਰਮ ਸੁਭੇ ਕਹੂੰ ਰਣ ਭੂਮ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਰੁ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ||
transliteration: Charam Baram Soubhe Kahoon Ran Bhoom Sastra Ru Astra||
translation: Somewhere there are shields and armours and somewhere there only weapons.

gurmukhi: ਮੁੰਡ ਤੁੰਡ ਧੁਜਾ ਪਤਾਕਾ ਟੂਕ ਟਾਕ ਅਰੇਕ ||
transliteration: Mounnd Tound Dhujaa Pataakaa Took Taakdarek||
translation: Somewhere there are heads, flags and ensigns scattered here and there.

gurmukhi: ਜੂਝ ਜੂਝ ਪਰੇ ਸਭੈ ਅਰਿ ਬਾਚਿਓ ਨਹੀ ੲੇਕ ||੩੬||
transliteration: Joojh Joojh Dare Sabhai Ar(i) Baachio Nahoo Ek||36||
translation: In the battlefield all the enemies have fallen down while fighting and none has been left alive.36.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਪ ਕੈ ਮਹਿਖੇਸ ਦਾਨੋ ਧਾੲਿਯੋ ਤਿੱਹ ਕਾਲ ||
transliteration: Kop Kai Mahikhes Daano Dhaaio Tih Kaal||
translation: Then in great ire, the demon Mahishasura marched forward.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੰਭਾਰ ਸੂਰੋ ਰੂਪ ਕੈ ਬਿਕਰਾਲ ||
transliteration: Astra Sastra Sanbhaar Sooro Roop Kai Bikraal||
translation: He appeared in a frightful form and held up all his weapons and arms.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲ ਪਾਣ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਣ ਲੈ ਤਿੱਹ ਮਾਰਿਯੋ ਤਤਕਾਲ ||
transliteration: Kaal Paan Kridaan Lai Tih Maariyo Tatkaal||
translation: The goddess Kalka took her sword in her hand and killed him instantly.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਤਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਬਿਖੈ ਮਿਲੀ ਤਜ ਬ੍ਹਮਰੰਧ੍ਰਿ ੳੁਤਾਲ ||੩੭||
transliteration: Jot(i) Jot(i) Bikhai Miloo Taj Brahmrandhr(i) Outaal||37||
translation: His soul left Brahmrandhir (life-channel of Dasam Dyar) and merged in Divine Light.37.
